top_problem_solved: A Story Close to My Heart – Healing Through Astrology A few years ago, a young doctor came to me in deep emotional distress. Though she was accomplished in her profession, her personal life was falling apart — a difficult marriage, repeated career setbacks, unexplained health challenges, and constant conflicts within her family. She had tried various methods to find peace, including therapy and spiritual practices, but nothing gave her the clarity or strength she was seeking. When I studied her birth chart, I immediately noticed the intensity of her karmic cycles. Rahu and Shani were in powerful transit, and she was going through a very challenging Mahadasha. I explained how these energies were influencing her thoughts, relationships, and life path. With her trust, I recommended a set of simple but powerful Vedic remedies — specific mantras, disciplined daily practices, and a subtle change in her approach to dharma and karma. These weren’t just astrological tips; they were life alignments rooted in Sanātana Dharma. Within months, shifts began. Her emotional burden lightened, her marriage stabilized, conflicts eased, and remarkably — after years of struggle — she conceived a child. She later told me that this was the turning point in her life. For me, this is not just astrology. It is Atma Jñāna in action — helping someone realign with their soul’s purpose. — Gopal Iyengar The Simple Astrologer
my_favourite_bni_story: From One Client to Twenty-Five Through BNI, I had the opportunity to work with a doctor who was going through a very difficult personal phase. Due to the confidential nature of her situation, I cannot share the specifics, but using my Vedic astrology guidance and personalized remedies, we were able to bring clarity and stability to her life. What followed was a true testament to the power of trust and results. In just two months, she referred over 25 clients to me — all through word of mouth and her confidence in the process. This experience reminded me that when solutions are genuine and rooted in dharma, people respond. And platforms like BNI help build those relationships with the right people at the right time. — Gopal Iyengar The Simple Astrologer

my_business:
Name: Dr.K.Sakuntala Jyoti 
Business Name: Jyoti's homoeo care 
Profession: Homeopathic Doctor
Specialty: Chronic Pain & Holistic Disease Management
Location: Hyderabad 
Years in Practice: 10+ Years
Hello everyone I am a homeopathic doctor with over a decade of experience in treating complex chronic diseases.my establishment is called JYOTI'S HOMOEO CARE. While I specialize in joint-related pain like knee pain, back pain, and shoulder stiffness, I also successfully manage a wide range of other chronic conditions including hypothyroidism, diabetes, migraine, PCOD, stomach ulcers, kidney stones, etc.
Additionally, I treat children's ailments such as tonsillitis, adenoids, bronchitis, and allergic cough, along with chronic skin issues like eczema, psoriasis, and acne.
My approach focuses on treating the root cause of illness using safe, effective, and non-invasive homoeopathic remedies. So if u have been diagnosed with an illness, first think of homeopathy and think of me.
top_product: Chronic Case Management Helping patients with chronic conditions like PCOS, migraines, or digestive issues who haven’t found relief through conventional treatments. Holistic Women's Health Program A homeopathic treatment plan tailored for hormonal imbalance, menstrual irregularities, or emotional well-being in women. Child Wellness Care Natural remedies for recurrent infections, ADHD, allergies, or behavioral concerns in children. Stress & Lifestyle Illness Recovery Homeopathy for professionals dealing with anxiety, burnout, insomnia, or IBS-like symptoms.
ideal_referral: Parents of children with frequent colds, asthma, or ADHD/ AUTISM symptoms Women dealing with PCOS, hormonal imbalances, adenomyosis/ endometriosis or painful periods etc Professionals experiencing stress, insomnia, or burnout Seniors looking for safe alternatives to manage chronic issues like joint pain, hypertension, or digestive problems Anyone dealing with skin issues like eczema, psoriasis, or acne and frustrated by temporary fixes
top_problem_solved: A 70-year-old woman with urinary incontinence—who was the mother-in-law of a BNI member—was referred to me. She had already undergone homeopathic treatment with another doctor for six months but saw no improvement. Due to her age and the previous lack of results, I honestly didn’t have high hopes initially, and the patient herself was quite doubtful. She was wearing diapers because her urine leaked constantly, affecting her quality of life. Despite this, I committed to giving my best care and tailored treatment. Just one month later, during her follow-up, she shared something incredible—she had been able to sit through a long pooja for several hours without feeling the urgent need to urinate. This moment was a breakthrough not only for her but also a reminder for me of the power of persistence and personalized care. It also shows how valuable our BNI network is—because this referral allowed me to help someone who was ready to give up hope
my_favourite_bni_story: One of my favorite BNI stories is about a young girl who was referred to me by a fellow BNI member—someone I had only spoken to once. Despite our brief interaction, he remembered what I do and trusted me enough to refer someone in need. The patient was experiencing severe, on-and-off abdominal pain that had no clear diagnosis. Her CT scan and blood work were completely normal, and the pain was labeled idiopathic. It was so debilitating that she couldn’t sit for long periods or manage her daily tasks. She and her family travelled over 25 kilometers just to reach my clinic, hoping for relief. After just one month of individualized homeopathic treatment, she experienced a 70% improvement in her condition. Seeing her regain her comfort and quality of life was incredibly rewarding—and it all started with a single conversation at BNI. This story reminds me how powerful our network is—how even one meaningful connection can help someone find hope and healing

top_problem_solved: A Story That Defines My Journey One of the most unforgettable moments in my career was when I was called to operate on a critically ill patient at midnight — just 20 days after giving birth to my second child. She was a second gravida, swine flu positive, already on ventilator support, with bilateral intercostal drains, and her oxygen levels were dangerously low. Shifting her to the operation theatre was impossible — so I had to operate right there in the ICU. There were no OT lights, no proper equipment, no ideal assistance. Almost 15–20 people gathered, holding mobile phone torches and table lamps to give me light. Under those conditions, I performed a high-risk caesarean section. The placenta was adherent, and there was every chance that I might have had to perform a caesarean hysterectomy. But by God’s grace, the patient’s strength, and my persistence, the placenta separated, the bleeding was controlled, and we avoided hysterectomy. Her baby, only 26 weeks and 500 grams, had little chance of survival. Her condition was also sinking, and many had lost hope. Yet the moment I delivered the baby, her oxygen saturation began to rise — from 20, to 30, to 100%. She remained on ventilatory support for one month, and slowly, her lungs revived. A month later, she walked out of the hospital alive. Today, 13 years later, both mother and child are healthy and thriving. Every year, on her birthday, she calls me to say, “Madam, please wish me — I am alive because of you.” This case reminds me every day why I chose this profession. Even as a new mother myself, just 20 days postpartum, I stood by a patient when hope seemed impossible. Medicine is not just about procedures — it is about courage, empathy, and giving life another chance.
my_favourite_bni_story: Even though my husband had been an active BNI member for 8 years, I had never visited a chapter myself — until one day, my 10th-grade school friend invited me as a visitor. I attended and immediately witnessed the power of BNI: the networking, the energy, and the support system it creates. Since then, my journey as a GAINAC has been incredible. I was recognized early on as Mentor Coordinator and have been given the highest preference in our chapter as one of the best GAINACs. Being part of BNI Amrita, a chapter primarily of doctors, has been an added privilege, allowing me to contribute my professional expertise while building meaningful connections.

name: Gayatri Sharma

my_business: I specialize in pharmaceutical outsourcing, focusing on the supply of advanced pharmaceutical intermediates and custom synthesis services. I work with multinational pharmaceutical companies to ensure they have the high-quality, compliant intermediates needed for clinical trials and commercial production. By leveraging my expertise in chemical manufacturing, I help my clients reduce production costs, shorten timelines, and ensure regulatory compliance throughout the supply chain. I also provide tailored solutions that meet the unique needs of R&D teams working on new drug development.
top_product: 1)Advanced Pharmaceutical Intermediates My top product is the supply of advanced pharmaceutical intermediates used in the development of critical drug compounds. These intermediates are tailored to meet the precise needs of R&D teams, ensuring high quality, compliance with regulatory standards, and fast turnaround times for clinical trials. 2) Custom Synthesis Solutions I specialize in providing custom synthesis solutions for pharmaceutical companies. From small-scale research batches to large-scale manufacturing, I help pharma companies create complex intermediates with exact specifications for their drug development process. 3) Regulatory-Compliant Manufacturing My top product is regulatory-compliant chemical manufacturing for the pharmaceutical industry. I provide advanced intermediates and API (active pharmaceutical ingredient) precursors with full documentation, ensuring all products meet GMP (Good Manufacturing Practice) and regulatory requirements for global markets. 4)Outsourced Chemical Manufacturing Services A core offering of mine is outsourced chemical manufacturing services, where I partner with pharma companies to produce high-quality intermediates and active ingredients. I focus on delivering high-efficiency, cost-effective solutions tailored to their scale and specific needs.
ideal_referral: My ideal referral is a Head of R&D, a Senior Scientist, a PhD working in the research or formulation department of a multinational pharmaceutical company. I’m specifically looking to connect with decision-makers or technical experts involved in sourcing advanced intermediates or custom synthesis solutions. Ideal companies are located in the US, Europe, or other global pharma hubs and are open to outsourcing high-quality, reliable chemical manufacturing to trusted partners.
top_problem_solved: One of the top problems I solved involved a multinational pharma company facing a delay in Product Development and Supply due to sourcing issues with a key intermediate. They needed a reliable supplier with Product development capabilities, fast turnaround, and full regulatory compliance. I helped them quickly identify a manufacturing solution, ensured all quality documentation was in place, and coordinated smooth delivery. The project was back on track within weeks — saving them significant time and potential costs.

my_favourite_bni_story: I once heard an inspiring story from Dr. Harsh about the power of unexpected connections. A member of his team was trying to get in touch with Mukesh Ambani, not exactly a casual LinkedIn connection. After exploring various routes, they eventually made progress through someone they never would have expected: a mutual contact who happened to be a piano teacher. It was a great reminder that you never know who in your network, or in your extended network, might open the door to your next big opportunity. Always be open to connections beyond the obvious.
